title: Ticket #4540: EC2 GAHP crashes if $ENV{USER} not set.
description:
keyID = getenv( "USER" );
        dprintf( D_FULLDEBUG, "Using '%s' as access key ID for x.509\n", keyID.c_str() );

Obviously, since it's possible for USER not be in the environment, this will end badly.

It's not at clear, however, if we actually need the username. It seems like it should be ignored (by the service).
remarks:
2014-Aug-15 13:19:23 by tlmiller:
Found this when I went digging: 

Date: Thu, 30 Jun 2011 15:43:45 -0500
From: Ted Hesselroth <tdh@fnal.gov>
To: Todd L Miller <tlmiller@cs.wisc.edu>
Cc: Steven Timm <timm@fnal.gov>
Subject: Re: endpoint for ec2+x509?

I have added your DN.

It's true that the AWSAccessKeyId is no longer needed. In OpenNebula this
corresponds to the username, which is looked from from the DN once the user
is authenticated.

I also found a more-recent message from an OpenNebula developer --

http://lists.opennebula.org/pipermail/users-opennebula.org/2013-January/021644.html

-- where the recommended testing procedure using curl doesn't include an AWSAccessKeyID parameter.

2014-Aug-21 09:00:42 by cat:
Neha Sharma has confirmed that the patch (against 8.0.7) fixed the problem for her. OSG plans to release its build of HTCondor 8.0.7 with the patch added. Please make the fix permanent in HTCondor 8.2 and beyond.
